creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: snowy pastoral scene: three human figures, one towing a sleigh loaded with packaged goods, make their way through the snow and into a snow-covered house; collection of buildings at center; trees and other buildings in distance at R; mountains in background; river and trees at R
inscription: left: 自摺　昭和二年作　柏原之雪 {jizuri, Shōwa ninen saku, Kashiwabara no yuki} | bottom, in pencil: Snow in Kashiwabara | Hiroshi Yoshida
markings: LRC, 2 red artist\'s seals H: 截襴 {sairan}
medium: Woodblock print; ink and color on paper
title: Snow in Kashiwabara
